result.execSummary:
The defendant Willie Charles Etherly was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: AS TO EACH COUNT:  Pay court costs, fees, assesments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge.  To be paid in full by 6/1/15.  Any remaining balance shall be due immediately.  Failure to pay will result in an entry of a civil judgment.
Concurrent with: Concurrent to count two, consecutive to any other sentence.   Release to Day Reporting Center only.  Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.

Provide a DNA sample if not already provided.
Pursuant to Wisconsin statutes section 973.176, the  Court Advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  firearm possession and voting.
Concurrent with: Concurrent to count one, consecutive to any other sentence.  Release to the Day Reporting Center only.  Court notes a strong objections to electronic monitoring.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Willie Charles Etherly

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Order, signed and filed.
The defendant's motion or request for release privileges/additional release privileges is denied.
The court intended the defendant to serve the sentence without release privileges.
Additional release privileges would unduly depreciate the seriousness of the offense, render the House of Correction time meaningless, and frustrate the court's specific sentencing intent.
Copies mailed to parties.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to Carolina Stark, Branch 17, for review. mag
Defendant's pro se request for work release.

Defendant Willie Charles Etherly in court with attorney Hazel Jean Washington.  Brandon A. Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Derrick E. 

As to COUNT 1:
Court ordered defendant to serve 210 DAYS in the House of Correction concurrent to COUNT 2, consecutive to any other sentence; release to the Day Reporting Center ONLY; credit for 0 days time served. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. 
Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to paid in full by 6/1/2015. Any remaining balance shall be due immediately; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment. 
Defendant to provide a DNA sample, if not already provided. 

As to COUNT 2:
Court ordered defendant to serve 210 DAYS in the House of Correction concurrent to COUNT 1, consecutive to any other sentence; release to the Day Reporting Center ONLY; credit for 0 days time served. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. 
Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to paid in full by 6/1/2015. Any remaining balance shall be due immediately; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment. 
Defendant to provide a DNA sample, if not already provided. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Defense requests a delayed report in date. Arguments heard. Court denies the Defense request for a delayed report in date. 

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 
Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
signed Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
Justice Point Pretrial Report dated October 10, 2014, received and filed.

Defendant Willie Charles Etherly in court with attorney Hazel Washington.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for Final Pretrial. Case proceeds to Plea Hearing. 
AS TO COUNT 1 & 2:
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.
Court vacates the Jury Trial scheduled for 9-15-2014. Court orders case adjourned for Sentencing on 10-13-2014 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Report dated September 8, 2014, received and filed.

Defendant Willie Charles Etherly in court. Paul Hauer for Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for Final Pretrial. Court is in receipt of a letter from Attorney Hazel Washington dated August 25, 2014, requesting an adjournment of the Final Pretrial. Court orders case adjourned for Final Pretrial on 9-9-2014 at 8:30 a.m. and the Jury Trial remains scheduled for 9-15-2014 at 9:00 a.m., Br. 17.  Jury trial scheduled for September 15, 2014 at 09:00 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 9, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Report dated August 25, 2014, received and filed.
from Attorney Washington requesting adjournment of the Final Pretrial scheduled for 8-26-2014 at 8:30 a.m., received and filed.
State's Requested Jury Instructions filed by ADA Danielle Chojnacki.
State's Amended Witness List filed by ADA Danielle Chojnacki.
State's Witness List, State's Motion in Limine, and State's Requested Jury Instructions, received and filed.

Defendant Willie Charles Etherly in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Willie Charles Etherly in custody.  Hanna R. Kolberg for Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
Case set for projected guilty plea and sentencing. Defense counsel informs the Court that defendant has retained Attorney Hazel Washington. Per call to Court from Attorney Hazel Washington, defendant has not retained her at this present time. Per the Court, dates will be given for final pretrial and jury trial.
Any and all motions are to be filed with the court by the final pretrial date.  All parties are notified that effective 8-03-14 this case will be assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17, in Room 313 of the Safety Building.
Case is adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference and Jury Trial scheduled, Branch 17.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 26, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Darryl E Smith in court, defendant Willie Charles Etherly not in court, in custody.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for Danielle Chojnacki for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 26.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 07-24-2014 at 08:36 am.

Attorney Darryl E Smith in court, defendant Willie Charles Etherly not in court, in custody.  Danielle E Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Scheduling conference scheduled for 06-16-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Willie Charles Etherly in court with attorney Darryl E Smith.  Defendant Willie Charles Etherly in custody.  Danielle E Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is reassigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26 due to the assignment of the Assistant District Attorney.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Willie Charles Etherly in court with attorney Richard J Johnson.  Defendant Willie Charles Etherly in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 5, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
